title: SSN leak due to editable slides
content:
Summary:
A presentation slide contains a screenshot of a records brief which contains an SSN
Description:
The slides try to redact the PII of the records with a blue block but we can remove it by editing the slides to remove the offending blue block
## Impact
Critical
## Step-by-step Reproduction Instructions
We can see an officer record brief, but the area with the SSN is blocked. We can make a copy of the file and edit it to remove the blue block thus allowing us to see the SSN
https://█████████/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/███████
Slide 84
███████
█████████
## Product, Version, and Configuration (If applicable)
N/A
## Suggested Mitigation/Remediation Actions
Purge Doc
Impact
Identity theft
steps: Access the presentation slide containing the redacted SSN (Slide 84)
Make a copy of the file and edit it to remove the blue block covering the SSN
vuln_description: The vulnerability involves the exposure of sensitive Personally Identifiable Information (SSN) due to improper redaction in a presentation slide. The redaction was done using a blue block that can be easily removed by editing the slide, revealing the underlying SSN.
reason: The vulnerability is straightforward to discover as it only involves editing a presentation file to remove a visible redaction block. There are no complex interactions or states involved, and the method to uncover the SSN is a common technique for bypassing simple redactions.
